10119BOSAA-d-01-19-91-ATK.Narrative: ON JANUARY 19, 1991, THE ENGINEER FOR TRAIN 193 WAS TAKING AMTRAK LOCOMOTIVES NUMBER 915 AND 942 FROM NEW HAVEN MOTOR STORAGE TO HIS TRAIN NUMBER 193 LOCATED ON TRACK 9 AT NEW HAVEN STATION. WHILE CROSSING FROM NEW HAVEN MOTOR STORAGE TO TRACK NUMBER ONE GOING WEST INTO TRACK NUMBER 9. AT THAT POINTTHE PANTOGRAPH BECAME TANGLED IN THE CANTENARY WHICH RESULTED IN THE PANTOGRAPH AND FOUR INSULATORSBEING RIPPPED FROM THE REAR OF LOCOMOTIVE 915. THE PANTOGRAPH MAIN ARM BENT AT THE BEGINNING OF THEARM. THE CARBON CARRIER SHOWED A BURNT SPOT AT THE EXTREME END OF THE SHOE HORN. THIS INDICATES THAT THIS PANTOGRAPH WAS PULLED OR GRABBED BY THE HIGH TENSION WIRE CAUSING THE UPPER ARM TO MOVE LITERALLY. THIS MADE THE PANTOGRAPH ARTICULATING ROD WHERE IT MEETS THE CHAIN SPRING OPEN RELEASING OR BREAKING THE BAN WHICH ATTACHED THE ARTICULATING ROD TO THE CHAIN. THEN THE OUTSIDE REMAINING ARM CHAIN THE END LINK FELL CAUSING THE UPPER PANTOGRAPH ARM AND CARRIER TO SETTLE ON THE TOP OF LINE NUMBER4 INSULATOR.NoneNoneNoneNone
